feed.title: Track Awesome Libgdx Updates Daily
feed.subtitle: üéÆ üìù A curated list of libGDX resources to help developers make awesome games.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Dec 03, 2024
entry.content:
Resources / Others

  • libGDX Plugin (‚≠ê157) - A plugin for IntelliJ IDEA and Android Studio that adds a number of libGDX features and tools, such as color previews and additional inspections for common mistakes.

Tutorials / General Learning Material

  • Book of Shaders (‚≠ê6.4k) - Step-by-step guide through the abstract and complex universe of Fragment Shaders. GLSL.
  • Game Programming Patterns - Architecture and design patterns for games.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Nov 28, 2024
entry.content:
Other Lists / General Learning Material

  • Awesome Gamedev (‚≠ê2.7k) - A collection of free software and free culture resources for making amazing games.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Nov 14, 2024
entry.content:
Assets / General Learning Material

  • Jsfxr - Quickly create unique sound effects by pressing a few buttons, excellent for prototyping.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Apr 10, 2024
entry.content:
Tutorials / Getting Started

  • Development Tutorial Playlist by Phillip Mod Dev - A series of videos going over the basics of libGDX.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Jul 15, 2023
entry.content:
Resources / Setup and Deployment

  • gdx-liftoff (‚≠ê607) - A modern setup tool for libGDX that supports more backends and allows adding libraries with one click.
  • libgdx-library-template (‚≠ê16) - A skeleton project for making new libraries, since they need different config.

Resources / User Interface

  • TextraTypist (‚≠ê116) - Like TypingLabel (below), but also supports styles, emoji, multiple fonts, clickable links, etc.

Resources / Visual Effects

  • colorful-gdx (‚≠ê89) - Expands how tinting can affect colors; also has many pre-written shaders.

Resources / Others

  • anim8-gdx (‚≠ê48) - Allows saving (animated) GIFs and PNGs from sequences of Pixmaps, with configurable dithering if needed.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on May 23, 2023
entry.content:
Resources / Editors

  • Mundus (‚≠ê174) - World/level editor for 3D worlds with a runtime for libGDX.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Nov 25, 2022
entry.content:
Resources / Audio

  • gdx-pd (‚≠ê29) - Pure Data extension for libGDX.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Oct 27, 2022
entry.content:
Resources / Audio

  • TuningFork (‚≠ê35) - Advanced 3D audio features for libGDX desktop users.
  • gdx-miniaudio (‚≠ê60) - Advanced Cross Platform Audio Engine for libGDX based on MiniAudio.
  • gdx-sfx (‚≠ê23) - Some goodies for better sound effects in libGDX.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on May 23, 2022
entry.content:
Resources / Visual Effects

  • gdx-graph (‚≠ê46) - Provides a GUI to design your rendering pipeline and shaders, and a library to easily incorporate them into your games.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Apr 30, 2022
entry.content:
Tutorials / Getting Started

  • Scene2D.UI From the Ground Up (‚≠ê465) - Covers the basics of UI design in Scene2D, libGDX's premiere scene graph and layout toolkit.

Tutorials / Advanced

  • Introduction to 3D Series - A tutorial series on libGDX 3D using gdx-gltf.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Mar 12, 2022
entry.content:
Resources / Visual Effects

  • HackLights (‚≠ê29) - Lightweight framebuffer based lighting engine for libGDX.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Jan 18, 2022
entry.content:
Resources / Physics

  • Box2D - One of the most popular physics libraries for 2D games.
  • Bullet - 3D Collision Detection and Rigid Body Dynamics Library.

Resources / User Interface

  • Freetype - Generate BitmapFonts of your desired size on the fly from lightweight .ttf font files.

Tutorials / Getting Started

  • Official libGDX Wiki - Official libGDX wiki that contains a huge amount of information.
  • libGDX External Tutorials - Big list of official unofficial tutorials.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Oct 10, 2021
entry.content:
Resources / Controllers

  • gdx-controllers (‚≠ê76) - Adds support to gamepads and joysticks.

Resources / Others

  • gdx-jnigen (‚≠ê80) - Small library that allows C/C++ code to be written inline with Java source code.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Apr 21, 2021
entry.content:
Tutorials / Getting Started

  • Tann's Hello libGDX - An excellent guide for beginners on how to create a game from scratch.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Apr 04, 2021
entry.content:
Resources / Editors

  • HyperLap2D (‚≠ê403) - Visual editor for complex 2D worlds and scenes with a runtime for libGDX.
  • Spine - Skeleton-based animation tool that focuses specifically on 2D animation for games.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Apr 03, 2021
entry.content:
Tutorials / Getting Started

  • Brandon Grasley's Space Shooter Game - Video tutorial series on making a complete Android game from scratch.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Oct 17, 2020
entry.content:
Resources / Visual Effects

  • libgdx-screenmanager (‚≠ê110) - A screen manager for libGDX supporting various transition effects

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Aug 24, 2020
entry.content:
Resources / Algorithms and AI

  • Simple Graphs (‚≠ê48) - A java library for graph data structures and algorithms (including fast pathfinding).

Resources / Physics

  • jbump (‚≠ê35) - Easy to implement AABB collision detection useful for platformers and other simple 2D games.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on May 15, 2020
entry.content:
Resources / Visual Effects

  • gdx-gltf (‚≠ê227) - GLTF 3D file format support (import/export), PBR shaders, and others advanced rendering.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Feb 16, 2020
entry.content:
Resources / Others

  • KTX (‚≠ê1.4k) - Kotlin extensions and utilities for libGDX.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Feb 15, 2020
entry.content:
Resources / Visual Effects

  • gdx-vfx (‚≠ê201) - Flexible post-processing shader visual effects based on libgdx-contribs-postprocessing.

Resources / Others

  • gdx-dbgagent (‚≠ê34) - Java Agent for debugging common issues, like objects not being disposed and constants such as Color.WHITE being modified.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Jan 19, 2020
entry.content:
Resources / User Interface

  • PieMenu (‚≠ê86) - Radial menus for Scene2D that are highly flexible and easy to customize.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Oct 31, 2019
entry.content:
Resources / User Interface

  • msdf-gdx (‚≠ê35) - Provides lightweight utilities to draw high-quality MSDF (multi-channel signed distance field) text on libGDX.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Aug 18, 2019
entry.content:
Resources / Services

  • gdx-gameanalytics (‚≠ê32) - Game Analytics REST API client implementation for libGDX. Works on all backends.

Resources / User Interface

  • Skin Composer (‚≠ê465) - Create skins for libGDX scene2d.ui with a graphical interface.
  • TenPatch (‚≠ê49) - An alternative to libGDX's 9patch implementation that implements multiple stretch regions.
  • TypingLabel (‚≠ê161) - A libGDX Label that appears as if it was being typed in real time.
  • VisUI (‚≠ê757) - Allows to create nice looking UI in libGDX using scene2d.ui. Note this is not a UI editor.

Resources / Others

  • Texture Packer GUI (‚≠ê660) - A simple way to pack and manage texture atlases for libGDX game framework.

Tutorials / Getting Started

  • Creating a Launcher - Video tutorial on using libGDX to make a game launcher.
  • Deploying with JPackage (‚≠ê465) - A tutorial on deploying libGDX games with JPackage via Gradle commands.

Tutorials / Advanced

  • Code Hotswapping - Video tutorial on enabling code hotswapping for libGDX projects to increase productivity.

Community / General Learning Material

  • Reddit - Unofficial subreddit for libGDX. Not a lot of activity.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Aug 15, 2019
entry.content:
Other Lists / General Learning Material

  • Game Accessibility Guidelines - A straightforward reference for inclusive game design, to ensure that games are just as fun for as wide a range of people as possible. Recommended

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Aug 10, 2019
entry.content:
Resources / Setup and Deployment

  • Packr (‚≠ê2.6k) - Packages your JAR, assets and a JVM for distribution on Windows, Linux and macOS.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Aug 09, 2019
entry.content:
Resources / Controllers

  • sdl2gdx (‚≠ê82) - Powerful gamepad implementation using SDL. Supports hundreds of controllers under the same mapping, rumble, and hotplugging.

Resources / Visual Effects

  • Shape Drawer (‚≠ê193) - A performant alternative to ShapeRenderer that avoids Batch flushing.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Jun 03, 2019
entry.content:
Tutorials / Advanced

  • Dynamic Textures with Pixmap - Details how to create a mask using Pixmaps.
  • iOS Deployment Tutorial - Deploying to iOS in 2019 using RoboVM.
  • Sub-pixel Perfect Smooth Scrolling - Pixel-perfect smooth scrolling.

Assets / General Learning Material

  • Kenney Assets - High quality assets for your game, from 2D and 3D art to sound effects.
  • OpenGameArt.org - Repository offering a variety of open content assets.
  • Game-Icons.net - Repository containing heaps of cool game related graphics.
  • freesound.org - Huge collaborative database of audio snippets, samples, recordings, bleeps.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on May 29, 2019
entry.content:
Resources / Algorithms and AI

  • gdx-ai (‚≠ê1.3k) - Artificial Intelligence framework featuring Steering Behaviors, Formation Motion, Pathfinding, Behavior Trees and Finite State Machines.

Resources / Controllers

  • gdx-controllerutils (‚≠ê60) - Adds Scene2D button input support, user configurable button mappings and hotplugging for LWJGL2.

Resources / Services

  • steamworks4j (‚≠ê496) - A thin wrapper which allows Java applications to access the Steamworks C++ API.

Resources / User Interface

  • gdx-dialogs (‚≠ê80) - Provides cross-platform support for native dialogs.
  • InGameConsole (‚≠ê136) - Allows a developer to add a console (similar to how it is featured in Source games) to their game.

Resources / Visual Effects

  • Box2DLights (‚≠ê262) - 2D lighting framework that uses Box2D for raycasting and OpenGL ES 2.0 for rendering.
  • Particle Park (‚≠ê75) - A showcase of downloadable particle effects with live previews.

Resources / Others

  • gdxGifRecorder (‚≠ê39) - A utility class that records a GIF and saves it automatically.
  • noise4j (‚≠ê105) - Simple map generators based on various procedural content generation tutorials.

entry.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on May 26, 2019
entry.content:
Resources / Entity Component System (ECS)

  • Artemis-odb (‚≠ê811) - High performance java based Entity-Component-System framework.
  • Ashley (‚≠ê890) - A Java entity system inspired by Ash & Artemis.

Resources / Services

  • gdx-facebook (‚≠ê60) - Provides cross-platform support for Facebook Graph API.
  • gdx-fireapp (‚≠ê64) - Cross-platform API for Firebase.
  • gdx-firebase (‚≠ê36) - Cross-platform (only Desktop/Android) API for Firebase.
  • gdx-gamesvcs (‚≠ê115) - Easy integration of gameservices, such as Google Play Games, Apple Game Center, and more.
  • gdx-pay (‚≠ê230) - Provides a cross-platform API for InApp purchasing.

Resources / User Interface

  • gdx-skins (‚≠ê528) - Free Scene2D GUI skins.
  • Ray3K Skins - Free Scene2D.UI skins with example code, custom drawables, and experimental features.

Tutorials / Getting Started

  • JSON in Game Dev - General tutorial on using JSON for storing data.
  • Progress Bar Design (‚≠ê465) - Discusses the pros and cons of different progress bar design techniques with examples.

Community / General Learning Material

  • Discord - An active chat with various leaders from the community available every day. Recommended

Other Lists / General Learning Material

  • Game Networking (‚≠ê8k) - A Curated List of Game Network Programming Resources.
  • Game Talks (‚≠ê1.1k) - A curated list of gaming talks (development, design, etc).
  • Java (‚≠ê44k) - A curated list of awesome Java frameworks, libraries and software.
  • Kotlin (‚≠ê11k) - A curated list of awesome Kotlin related stuff.
  • Magic Tools (‚≠ê15k) - A list of Game Development resources to make magic happen.
